Takes the snapshot for the given keyspaces. A snapshot name must be specified.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: the tag given to the snapshot

parameters.name: kn
parameters.description: Keyspace(s) to snapshot. Multiple keyspaces can be provided using a comma-separated list. If omitted, snapshot all keyspaces.

parameters.name: cf
parameters.description: Table(s) to snapshot. Multiple tables (in a single keyspace) can be provided using a comma-separated list. If omitted, snapshot all tables in the given keyspace(s).

parameters.name: sf
parameters.description: Skip flush. When set to "true", do not flush memtables before snapshotting (snapshot will not contain unflushed data)

operations.summary: Remove the snapshot with the given name from the given keyspaces. If no tag is specified all snapshots will be removed

parameters.name: tag

parameters.name: kn
parameters.description: Comma-separated keyspaces name that their snapshot will be deleted

parameters.name: cf
parameters.description: an optional table name that its snapshot will be deleted

operations.summary: Get the true size taken by all snapshots across all keyspaces.
Forces major compaction in all keyspaces

parameters.name: flush_memtables
parameters.description: Controls flushing of memtables before compaction (true by default). Set to "false" to skip automatic flushing of memtables before compaction, e.g. when tables were flushed explicitly before invoking the compaction api.

parameters.name: consider_only_existing_data
parameters.description: Set to "true" to flush all memtables and force tombstone garbage collection to check only the sstables being compacted (false by default). The memtable, commitlog and other uncompacted sstables will not be checked during tombstone garbage collection.

operations.summary: Scrub (deserialize + reserialize at the latest version, resolving corruptions if any) the given keyspace. If columnFamilies array is empty, all CFs are scrubbed. Scrubbed CFs will be snapshotted first, if disableSnapshot is false. Scrub has the following modes: Abort (default) - abort scrub if corruption is detected; Skip (same as `skip_corrupted=true`) skip over corrupt data, omitting them from the output; Segregate - segregate data into multiple sstables if needed, such that each sstable contains data with valid order; Validate - read (no rewrite) and validate data, logging any problems found.

parameters.name: disable_snapshot
parameters.description: When set to true, disable snapshot

parameters.name: skip_corrupted
parameters.description: When set to true, skip corrupted

parameters.name: scrub_mode
parameters.description: How to handle corrupt data (overrides 'skip_corrupted');

parameters.name: quarantine_mode
parameters.description: Controls whether to scrub quarantined sstables (default INCLUDE)

parameters.name: keyspace
parameters.description: The keyspace to query about

parameters.name: cf
parameters.description: Comma-separated column family names

operations.summary: Rewrite all sstables to the latest version. Unlike scrub, it doesn't skip bad rows and do not snapshot sstables first.

parameters.name: keyspace
parameters.description: The keyspace

parameters.name: exclude_current_version
parameters.description: When set to true exclude current version

parameters.name: cf
parameters.description: Comma-separated column family names

operations.summary: Return an array with the ids of the currently active repairs
Query the repair status and return when the repair is finished or timeout

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The repair ID to check for status

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Seconds to wait before the query returns even if the repair is not finished. The value -1 or not providing this parameter means no timeout

operations.summary: Invoke repair asynchronously. You can track repair progress by using the get supplying id

parameters.name: keyspace
parameters.description: The keyspace to repair

parameters.name: primaryRange
parameters.description: If the value is the string 'true' with any capitalization, repair only the first range returned by the partitioner.

parameters.name: parallelism
parameters.description: Repair parallelism, can be 0 (sequential), 1 (parallel) or 2 (datacenter-aware).

parameters.name: incremental
parameters.description: If the value is the string 'true' with any capitalization, perform incremental repair.

parameters.name: jobThreads
parameters.description: An integer specifying the parallelism on each node.

parameters.name: ranges
parameters.description: An explicit list of ranges to repair, overriding the default choice. Each range is expressed as token1:token2, and multiple ranges can be given as a comma separated list.

parameters.name: startToken
parameters.description: Token on which to begin repair

parameters.name: endToken
parameters.description: Token on which to end repair

parameters.name: columnFamilies
parameters.description: Which column families to repair in the given keyspace. Multiple columns families can be named separated by commas. If this option is missing, all column families in the keyspace are repaired.

parameters.name: dataCenters
parameters.description: Which data centers are to participate in this repair. Multiple data centers can be listed separated by commas.

parameters.name: hosts
parameters.description: Which hosts are to participate in this repair. Multiple hosts can be listed separated by commas.

parameters.name: ignore_nodes
parameters.description: Which hosts are to ignore in this repair. Multiple hosts can be listed separated by commas.

parameters.name: trace
parameters.description: If the value is the string 'true' with any capitalization, enable tracing of the repair.

parameters.name: ranges_parallelism
parameters.description: An integer specifying the number of ranges to repair in parallel by user request. If this number is bigger than the max_repair_ranges_in_parallel calculated by Scylla core, the smaller one will be used.

parameters.name: small_table_optimization
parameters.description: If the value is the string 'true' with any capitalization, perform small table optimization. When this option is enabled, user can send the repair request to any of the nodes in the cluster. There is no need to send repair requests to multiple nodes. All token ranges for the table will be repaired automatically.

operations.summary: Track already running repair progress

parameters.name: keyspace
parameters.description: The keyspace repair is running on

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The repair ID to check for status

set the logging level at runtime

If both classQualifer and level are empty/null, it will reload the configuration to reset.
If classQualifer is not empty but level is empty/null, it will set the level to null for the defined classQualifer
If level cannot be parsed, then the level will be defaulted to DEBUG

The logback configuration should have < jmxConfigurator /> set

makes node unavailable for writes, flushes memtables and replays commitlog

Truncates (deletes) the given columnFamily from the provided keyspace. Calling truncate results in actual deletion of all data in the cluster under the given columnFamily and it will fail unless all hosts are up. All data in the given column family will be deleted, but its definition will not be affected.

parameters.description: Column family name
